case_vignette:
An 8-year-old African-American boy presents with a 3-day history of fever, pain, and a rash on his trunk. On examination, the patient has several fragile, bullous lesions on his trunk, many of which have eroded, exposing erythematous, annular lesions. The patient is febrile and shaking in the office, and he appears to be in pain. He has no other relevant social or family history and does not take any medications. His mother is very concerned about her son. The patient's mother reports that the patient has been experiencing a lot of pain and discomfort, and she is worried that he may have a serious illness.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have had a fever, pain, and a rash on my trunk for the last three days.
Has the rash spread to any other areas than your trunk?
No, the rash is only on my trunk.
Can you describe the appearance of the rash? Are they blister-like, red patches, or something else?
The rash has several fragile, blister-like lesions, and many have eroded, exposing red, ring-shaped patches.
Do you currently have or recently had any respiratory symptoms like a cough or a runny nose?
No, I do not have any respiratory symptoms like a cough or a runny nose.
Have you had chickenpox before or been vaccinated against it?
I do not have any relevant social or family history to report, including vaccinations or past illnesses.
How old are you?
I am 8 years old.
Final Diagnosis: Herpes Zoster (Shingles)
